intro: Solanum tuberosum var. utillissimum, commonly known as the potato, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its starchy underground tubers, which are the primary edible part. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring simple, alternate, ovate leaves with a hairy surface. It produces clusters of small, white or pale green flowers that develop into berries containing numerous seeds. This variety is cultivated worldwide for its nutritional value and versatility in culinary uses.
